title: Feeling Overwhelmed and Out of Control
friendly_definition: Emotional Dysregulation is when your feelings are all over the place, making you feel overwhelmed and out of control in your mind and body.
real_life_example: Imagine feeling so angry that you can't stop yelling or crying, even though you want to. Your emotions feel like a rollercoaster you can't get off.
often_confused_with: People might think you're just being dramatic or overreacting, but it's more than that. It's like your emotions are in the driver's seat, not you.
research_insight: Research shows that emotional instability plays a big role in why people with Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD) struggle with self-harm. It's like their emotions are so intense that they can't handle them in a healthy way.
personal_check_in: Do you ever feel like your emotions are too much to handle? How do you cope when you feel overwhelmed by your feelings?
